title: PM Modi and French President Emmanuel Macron Attend AI India Summit
description: The AI Impact Summit 2026 Day 4 Live Updates feature two world leaders discussing the future of artificial intelligence.
content:
#### Background The Artificial Intelligence (AI) Impact Summit, one of India's leading events for AI innovation and policy discussions, is back for its fourth day. The summit, hosted by the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeIT), has attracted hundreds of professionals from across the country to discuss the future direction of artificial intelligence.

This year’s event is expected to be highly impactful as it marks an important milestone in India's journey towards becoming a global leader in AI research and development. The summit aims not just to promote innovation but also to address critical challenges such as ethics, accessibility, and societal impact that come with AI advancements.

#### Key Developments The live updates from the summit have been both informative and inspiring. One of the most notable moments was when Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the audience, emphasizing the government’s commitment to fostering a conducive environment for AI development in India. He highlighted several initiatives aimed at ensuring inclusivity and ethical considerations while promoting technological progress.

French President Emmanuel Macron also made a significant contribution with his speech on the role of technology in shaping societies. His insights emphasized the importance of international collaboration and the need for a global framework that ensures equitable access to AI benefits across all nations, particularly in developing countries like India.

Industry Impact

The event has not only provided valuable discussions but also practical insights into how businesses can leverage AI effectively while adhering to regulatory standards and ethical guidelines. Sessions have focused on cutting-edge research, case studies of successful AI implementations, and strategies for overcoming common challenges faced by entrepreneurs and startups in the tech sector.

One notable success story highlighted was a private company that leveraged AI-driven solutions to optimize its supply chain operations, resulting in significant cost savings and improved efficiency. This underscores the practical application of AI beyond just research projects.

#### Expert Perspective The summit has also featured expert panel discussions led by leading figures in the field, including Dr. Ashok Khare, a renowned scientist at CSIR-National Centre for Artificial Intelligence (NCAI), who shared his insights on current trends and future challenges in AI research.

Dr. Khare emphasized the importance of interdisciplinary collaboration to tackle complex problems that require multidisciplinary expertise. He also highlighted the need for continuous learning and adaptation as technologies evolve, urging participants to stay updated with the latest advancements and ethical considerations.

What This Means

The summit has not only provided an opportunity for leaders from different walks of life to come together but has also set a benchmark for future AI development in India. The discussions have highlighted the importance of collaboration across sectors and between stakeholders ranging from government bodies, private enterprises, research institutions, and civil society organizations.

Real-world examples such as these underscored how artificial intelligence can contribute positively to industries beyond just data processing. They also highlighted that ethical considerations are not just buzzwords but integral parts of AI innovation that should be built into the very fabric of AI development practices.

#### Looking Ahead The future looks promising for India’s AI sector, with several promising initiatives on the horizon. The summit has already laid down a solid foundation for more structured cooperation between industry, academia, and government bodies to foster an ecosystem conducive to continued growth in the field of artificial intelligence.

Looking ahead, experts predict a surge in demand for specialized skills related to AI development, deployment, and ethical considerations. Aspiring professionals can expect increased job opportunities in fields such as data science, machine learning, robotics, and cybersecurity, which will be crucial for India’s technological advancements.

###
